    • Method Detail

      • get

        public static java.lang.Object get(java.lang.Object a,
                                   int fromIndex,
                                   int toIndex)
        Gets a chunk from a one-dimensional array.
        Parameters:
        a - a one dimensional array.
        fromIndex -
        toIndex -
        Returns:
        an array which content is the chunk extracted from the array passed as parameter.

        Example:

        If you have an array of int and want to get a chunk from index 2 to index 4 

         int[] myArrayOfInt = ...;
 int[] chunk = (int[])iArray.get(myArrayOfInt,2,4);

      • get

        public static java.lang.Object get(java.lang.Object m,
                                   int fromRow,
                                   int toRow,
                                   int fromCol,
                                   int toCol)
        Gets a chunk from a two-dimensional array.
        Parameters:
        m - a two-dimensional array.
        fromRow -
        toRow -
        fromCol -
        toCol -
        Returns:
        a two-dimensional array with the content of the chunk extracted from the array passed as parameter.

        Example:

        If you have a matrix and want to get a chunk from row 0 to row 3 and from col 1 to col 2 

         double[][] myMatrix = ...;
 double[][] chunk = (double[][])iArray.get(myMatrix,0,3,1,2);

      • get

        public static java.lang.Object get(java.lang.Object c,
                                   int fromI,
                                   int toI,
                                   int fromJ,
                                   int toJ,
                                   int fromK,
                                   int toK)
        Gets a chunk from a three-dimensional array.
        Parameters:
        c - a three-dimensional array.
        fromI -
        toI -
        fromJ -
        toJ -
        fromK -
        toK -
        Returns:
        a three-dimensional array with the content of the chunk extracted from the array passed as parameter.

        Example:

        If you have a cube and want to get a chunk from row 1 to row 5 from col 3 to col 7 and from depth 0 to depth 4 

         float[][][] myCube = ...;
 float[][][] chunk = (float[][][])iArray.get(myCube,1,5,3,7,0,4);

      • clone

        public static java.lang.Object clone(java.lang.Object a)
        Makes a clone of the array passed as parameter. It can be one, two or three-dimensional.
        Parameters:
        a - an array to clone.
        Returns:
        the cloned array.

        Example:

        If you have an array of object of any class and want to clone it. 

         MyClass[][] myMatrix = ...;
 MyClass[][] clonedMatrix = (MyClass[][])iArray.clone(myMatrix);

      • resize

        public static java.lang.Object resize(java.lang.Object a,
                                      int newSize)
        Resizes the one-dimensional array passed as parameter.
        Parameters:
        a - one-dimensional array.
        newSize -
        Returns:
        the resized array. The array passed as parameter does not change unless you asign the result to itself.

        Example: 

         byte[] byteVector = ...;
 byte[] resizedByteVector = (byte[])iArray.resize(byteVector,12);

        If the size is greater than the original array, new positions are set to zero. If the size is equal to the original You will get a copy of the array. If the size is lower, you will get a chunk from 0 to newSize-1 from the original array.

      • resize

        public static java.lang.Object resize(java.lang.Object m,
                                      int rows,
                                      int cols)
        Resizes the two-dimensional array passed as parameter.
        Parameters:
        m - a two-dimensional array.
        rows -
        cols -
        Returns:
        the two-dimensional resized array. The array passed as parameter does not change unless you asign the result to itself.

        Example: 

         short[][] myShortMatrix = ...;
 short[][] resizedShortMatrix = (short[][])iArray.resize(myShortMatrix,7,7);

      • resize

        public static java.lang.Object resize(java.lang.Object c,
                                      int i,
                                      int j,
                                      int k)
        Resizes the three-dimensional array passed as parameter.
        Parameters:
        i -
        j -
        k -
        Returns:
        the three-dimensional resized array. The array passed as parameter does not change unless you asign the result to itself.

        Example: 

         MyClass[][][] myCube = ...;
 MyClass[][][] resizedCube = (MyClass[][][])iArray.resize(mycube,12,8,10);

      • print

        public static void print(java.lang.Object a,
                         java.lang.String label)
        Prints the content of the array passed as parameter. It can be one,two, or three-dimensional.
        Parameters:
        a - an array.
        label - a text label to show.

        Example:

        If you have an array and want to print it. 

         long[] myArray = ...;
 iArray.print(myArray, "vector");
